page.title: 09Ecology _ Leeswood area
page.content: The ecology of this area is typical of grassland areas, of which the area is mainly composed.Most of the fields are separated by hedges of quickthorn or blackthorn. In the woods there are small mammals which include squirrels,mice,hedgehogs badgers and rabbits which are fascina_ ting to see. There is a wide range of insects to see such as crickets,grasshoppers and different kinds of spiders etc. We have several streams in the area and a large pond which has several varieties of coarse fish.The pond pro- vides homes for frogs and other amphibians. This area is peaceful and is lovely for going on nature walks.
